speaker: THERSITES
text: How now, Thersites? What, lost in the

speaker: THERSITES
text: labyrinth of thy fury? Shall the elephant Ajax carry

speaker: THERSITES
text: it thus? He beats me, and I rail at him. O, worthy

speaker: THERSITES
text: satisfaction! Would it were otherwise, that I could

speaker: THERSITES
text: beat him whilst he railed at me. ’Sfoot, I’ll learn to

speaker: THERSITES
text: conjure and raise devils but I’ll see some issue of

speaker: THERSITES
text: my spiteful execrations. Then there’s Achilles, a

speaker: THERSITES
text: rare enginer! If Troy be not taken till these two undermine

speaker: THERSITES
text: it, the walls will stand till they fall of

speaker: THERSITES
text: themselves. O thou great thunder-darter of Olympus,

speaker: THERSITES
text: forget that thou art Jove, the king of gods;

speaker: THERSITES
text: and, Mercury, lose all the serpentine craft of thy

speaker: THERSITES
text: caduceus, if you take not that little, little, less than

speaker: THERSITES
text: little wit from them that they have, which short-armed

speaker: THERSITES
text: ignorance itself knows is so abundant

speaker: THERSITES
text: scarce it will not in circumvention deliver a fly

speaker: THERSITES
text: from a spider without drawing their massy irons

speaker: THERSITES
text: and cutting the web. After this, the vengeance on

speaker: THERSITES
text: the whole camp! Or rather, the Neapolitan bone-ache!

speaker: THERSITES

speaker: THERSITES
text: on those that war for a placket. I have said my

speaker: THERSITES
text: prayers, and devil Envy say “Amen.”—What ho,

speaker: THERSITES

speaker: THERSITES

speaker: THERSITES

speaker: THERSITES

speaker: THERSITES
